fd_vs_ppf_calculator.h1: FD vs PPF Returns Calculator 2025 тАФ Compare Fixed Deposit & PPF
fd_vs_ppf_calculator.description: Enter your investment amount and tenure to see a side-by-side comparison of maturity value, tax impact, and post-tax returns for Fixed Deposits and Public Provident Fund. Make an informed decision.
fd_vs_ppf_calculator.title: FD vs PPF Calculator
fd_vs_ppf_calculator.form_description: Compare post-tax returns from a lump-sum FD vs recurring PPF investment.
fd_vs_ppf_calculator.result_snapshot: For this scenario, {winner} wins by approximately {difference} after tax.

clarifier_note.title: Important тАФ How We Compare
clarifier_note.body: The calculator treats the 'Investment Amount' as a one-time lump-sum for the FD and as a recurring annual deposit for PPF. This means the total money deployed differs. For example, a тВ╣1 lakh investment becomes a тВ╣1 lakh single deposit in FD vs. a total of тВ╣15 lakh (1L ├Ч 15 years) in PPF. This models a common real-world investment choice.

assumptions.title: Calculator Assumptions
assumptions.body:
• PPF is modelled with annual compounding at the specified rate and a default maturity of 15 years. Deposits are assumed at the start of each year.
  • FD is modelled as a one-time lump-sum with annual compounding. Interest is taxed at your selected marginal rate.
  • Results are nominal (not inflation-adjusted). Always verify with official sources like PFRDA and the Income Tax Dept.

quick_answer.title: Quick Answer: Which is better, FD or PPF?
quick_answer.body: For long-term, tax-free wealth creation (like retirement), PPF is almost always better due to its EEE tax status and compounding benefits. For short-term goals or emergency funds where you need liquidity, an FD is more suitable despite the tax on interest. Use our PPF Calculator or NPS Calculator to see the exact difference for your amount.

example1.title: Example 1 тАФ FD (Lump-Sum)
example1.body:
Input: тВ╣100,000 lump-sum, 7% p.a., 15 years, 30% tax bracket.
Calculation:
  1. Future Value = 100,000 ├Ч (1.07)^15 = тВ╣275,903.
  2. Total Interest = 275,903 - 100,000 = тВ╣175,903.
  3. Tax on Interest (30%) = 0.30 ├Ч 175,903 = тВ╣52,771.
  4. Post-Tax Maturity = 275,903 - 52,771 = тВ╣223,132.

example2.title: Example 2 тАФ PPF (Recurring Annual Deposit)
example2.body:
Input: тВ╣100,000 paid at the start of each year for 15 years, 7.1% p.a.
Calculation (Annuity Due Formula):
Future Value = P ├Ч [((1 + r)^n - 1) / r] ├Ч (1 + r)
This computes to a tax-free maturity of тВ╣2,712,139 on a total investment of тВ╣1,500,000.

ppf_features.title: PPF: Key Features, Rules & Tax Benefits
points: Tax Treatment: Exempt-Exempt-Exempt (EEE). Contributions, interest, and maturity are all tax-free. (Source: Income Tax Dept)
Lock-in Period: 15 years, can be extended in blocks of 5 years.
Interest Rate: Set by the government quarterly. Generally higher than FD rates. (Source: NSI)
Contribution Limit: Min тВ╣500, Max тВ╣1.5 lakh per financial year.
Best For: Long-term goals like retirement, children's education, and disciplined, tax-free saving.

fd_features.title: FD: Key Features, Rules & Tax Implications
points: Tax Treatment: Interest earned is fully taxable as per your income tax slab.
Lock-in Period: Flexible, ranging from 7 days to 10 years. Premature withdrawal is possible with a penalty.
Interest Rate: Fixed at the time of investment for the entire tenure. Varies by bank and tenure.
Contribution Limit: No upper limit on investment.
Insurance: Deposits are insured up to тВ╣5 lakh by DICGC. (Source: DICGC)
Best For: Short to medium-term goals, emergency funds, and predictable returns for risk-averse investors.

comparison.title: FD vs PPF: Detailed Comparison Table

tax_impact.title: Tax Impact Explained (how tax affects effective returns)
tax_impact.body: The biggest difference between FD and PPF is tax. Interest from an FD is added to your 'Income from Other Sources' and taxed at your marginal slab rate. For example, if you are in the 30% tax bracket, a 7% FD effectively yields only 4.9% post-tax. In contrast, the entire interest earned from PPF is tax-free, making its effective return much higher.

checklist.title: How to Choose: A Quick Checklist
points: Goal Horizon: Long-term (>10 years)? PPF is better. Short-term (<5 years)? FD is the only option.
Tax Bracket: In a higher tax bracket (20-30%)? The tax-free nature of PPF becomes much more attractive.
Liquidity Needs: Need access to your money for emergencies? FD offers better liquidity, despite penalties.
Risk Appetite: If you want zero risk, both are safe, but PPF is backed by the sovereign government.
Investment Amount: Investing over тВ╣1.5 lakh annually? You'll have to use FDs or other options for the surplus.
Age: For senior citizens, banks often offer higher FD rates, which might make them more competitive.

faqs.question: FD vs PPF тАФ which is better?
faqs.answer: It depends: PPF is better for long-term, tax-free growth; FD is better for short-term goals and liquidity. Use the calculator to compare the exact numeric outcome for your inputs.

faqs.question: How to calculate FD returns after tax?
faqs.answer: Compute FD future value with compound interest, subtract the original principal to get interest earned, then apply your marginal tax rate to that interest to find tax owed. Post-tax maturity = gross maturity тИТ tax.

faqs.question: How is PPF interest calculated?
faqs.answer: PPF interest is compounded annually at the rate notified quarterly by the government. If you deposit at the start of each year (annuity-due), the formula uses an annuity multiplier.

faqs.question: What if I want to compare equal total investments?
faqs.answer: This feature is coming soon. Currently, the tool compares a one-time FD investment against a recurring PPF investment, which is a common real-world scenario.

faqs.question: Does PPF allow early withdrawals?
faqs.answer: Partial withdrawals are permitted from the 7th financial year under limits; loans are available between years 3 and 6. Full premature closure is allowed only in specific cases (e.g., serious illness) and may carry a penalty.

faqs.question: Is FD interest taxable?
faqs.answer: Yes тАФ FD interest is taxable at your marginal income tax slab. TDS (10%) is applicable above statutory thresholds; however, actual tax liability will depend on your slab.

faqs.question: Can I claim tax benefits for FD?
faqs.answer: Only 5-year tax-saving FDs qualify for deduction under Section 80C; their interest remains taxable.

faqs.question: Should a senior citizen choose FD or PPF?
faqs.answer: Many seniors use a mix тАФ FDs for monthly income (banks give senior citizen rates) and PPF if they want a tax-free long-term corpus. The calculator helps quantify trade-offs.

faqs.question: What happens if I miss a PPF deposit?
faqs.answer: Missing the minimum contribution makes the account inactive; revival requires payment for missed years plus a penalty per missed year. Check your bank/Post Office for exact revival process.

faqs.question: Are PPF rates fixed forever?
faqs.answer: No тАФ PPF rates are reviewed and notified by the government quarterly. The calculator allows you to edit the rate to model different scenarios.

faqs.question: Can NRIs open PPF accounts?
faqs.answer: NRIs cannot open new PPF accounts; existing accounts continue under specific conditions. Confirm current rules with the bank/Post Office and official guidelines.

faqs.question: How can I use FD laddering with PPF?
faqs.answer: A common strategy: max out PPF for tax-free long-term growth, and ladder FDs with staggered maturities for liquidity. This balances safety, liquidity and tax efficiency.

conclusion.title: Final Thoughts: Making the Right Choice
conclusion.body: Choosing between a Fixed Deposit and the Public Provident Fund ultimately depends on your financial goals, investment horizon, and need for liquidity. For secure, tax-free, long-term growth, PPF is an unmatched tool. For predictable returns on short-term savings, an FD provides reliability and access. Use our FD vs PPF Returns Calculator to model various scenarios and make an informed decision that best suits your financial plan.
